processing_time.notes: Initial identifier discovery was efficient due to clear labeling in the source document. External verification proceeded without significant delays.

study_identification.title: Does Increased Consolidated Nighttime Sleep Facilitate Attentional Control? A Pilot Study of Nap Restriction in Preschoolers

authors.all_authors: Janet C. Lam, Taylor A. Koriakin, Steven M. Scharf, Thornton B. A. Mason, E. Mark Mahone

doi.cross_verification: VERIFIED - DOI resolves to the correct article on the journal website and PubMed.
doi.notes: DOI was clearly stated on the first page of the document.

pmid.cross_verification: VERIFIED - PMID links to the same study as the DOI.
pmid.notes: PMID was not present in the main text but was successfully located via a PubMed search using the known DOI.

registration_numbers.value: Not found after paper and external query
registration_numbers.source: Paper section 'Method' [cite: 81-148] and external query: web_search('site:clinicaltrials.gov "nap restriction" "Kennedy Krieger Institute" "E. Mark Mahone"')
registration_numbers.notes: A thorough review of the 'Method' section revealed no mention of a trial registration number. External searches of major registries (ClinicalTrials.gov, ISRCTN) using author names, institution, and keywords did not yield a relevant registration for this pilot study.

retraction_resources.successful: All attempted resources were accessible and provided results.

integrity_resources.author_query_methods: Full name queries for first and last authors ('Janet C. Lam', 'E. Mark Mahone') combined with terms like 'retraction' or 'misconduct'.

registry_resources.query_strategies: Searched using author names, intervention keywords ('nap restriction'), and institution ('Kennedy Krieger Institute').

retraction_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying 5 resources. The PubMed and CrossRef records for this article show no signs of retraction.

query_summary.search_terms_effective: DOI and PMID were most effective for targeted searches.
query_summary.comprehensive_coverage: YES - Primary databases, publisher site, and a specialized integrity database were all queried.

expression_of_concern_investigation.findings: No findings found after querying PubMed, the publisher's website, and general web searches.
expression_of_concern_investigation.corrections_found: No errata or corrigenda were found for this article.

team_integrity_investigation.findings: No issues found across 2 key authors and 4 resources. Searches for Janet C. Lam and E. Mark Mahone on PubMed, Retraction Watch, ORI.HHS.gov, and Google Scholar revealed no retractions, expressions of concern, or findings of misconduct linked to their names.

authors_investigated.databases_used: PubMed, Retraction Watch, Google Scholar, ORI.HHS.gov

query_summary.primary_databases: PubMed, Google Scholar - no adverse findings.
query_summary.secondary_resources: Retraction Watch, ORI.HHS.gov - no adverse findings.

query_summary.query_methods: Searched by author, institution, and keywords ('nap restriction', 'preschoolers').

registration_timing_investigation.limitations: The study is described as a 'pilot study' [cite: 6] and may not have required formal public registration at the time, or it may predate more stringent registration requirements for non-federally funded behavioral interventions. The lack of a registration number in the manuscript prevents definitive analysis.

verification_checklist.identifier_formats_verified: YES - DOI pattern and PMID digits confirmed.
verification_checklist.cross_verification_completed: 1/1 identifiers cross-verified (DOI and PMID confirm each other).

reliability_metrics.database_consistency: Results were consistent across all queried resources.
reliability_metrics.findings_quality: Strong - definitive absence of retraction or other concerns.

overall_analysis.major_limitations: The only limitation is the inability to verify trial registration, which is common for smaller pilot studies of this nature and time period. This does not detract from the high confidence in the other integrity checks.
overall_analysis.methodology_effectiveness: The identifier-first methodology was highly effective. The discovered DOI and PMID allowed for rapid and conclusive verification across all integrity databases.

metadata.database_access_method: Web search for all external databases - no direct API access
metadata.web_search_strategy: Site-specific searches to avoid rate limiting
metadata.rate_limiting_eliminated: YES - using web_search() instead of direct database APIs
metadata.special_notes: The study was funded by the Thomas Wilson Foundation and the Kennedy Krieger Institute IDDRC[cite: 266].
metadata.reproducibility_notes: Key web searches included: 'site:pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov 10.1177/1087054715569281', 'site:retractionwatch.com "E. Mark Mahone"', 'site:clinicaltrials.gov "nap restriction" "Kennedy Krieger"'.
